reviewText:
This game had its moments, but from the 2nd episode on I just kept wishing it would be over soon. To be honest I don't think I can even stand to write a full review.

What it is:
It's a cute Minecraft-themed cinematic quicktime event game (series?).

Who it is for:
I would say the target audience is teenagers, people who can't get enough Minecraft, and people who enjoy episodic content.

What I liked:
It's cute. Some of the story was entertaining. Some of the characters were engaging sometimes. Some of the scenery was nice. I enjoyed Professor Farnsworth's narration.

What I didn't like:
Oh boy. This game has sort of an identity crisis. It (and consequently you) doesn't know whether it's a point-and-click, sit-and-watch, or hunt-and-peck adventure. It tries to be all three, but as a result I often found myself taken off-guard, completely unawares and barely able to accurately respond to whatever nonsense was being thrown at me.

The game expects you to be engaged and ready without a moments notice, yet will go for long stretches of automated sequences with no input from the player. In a normal game where there is a clear distinction between action and automation that's great, but in this game it kind of blows.

The dialogue was not all that interesting, although the plot had promise. It's a shame because sooooo much of this game is just inane conversation.

I'm just glad it's over.

reviewText:
Minecraft: Story Mode is a story about you, the protagonist, and your group of friends competing to win the EnderCon. It might just seem like a simple building contest, but there's just much more to that. A sinister plot, devised by a former member of the Order of the Stone, was initially designed for vengeance and revenge. However, something goes horribly wrong. Eventually, you find yourself to be of more importance than you think you'd be in a game taking place in a Minecraft world. You, playing as the male or female protagonist Jesse, go on an epic adventure to places people wouldn't dare to go to. Experiencing both hardships and tender moments, you are left to make the tough decisions for your group and ultimately decide how the story will go. Despite the circumstances however, your group still finds a way to crack crude jokes and stay optimistic. Will you put the health of others before your own, or will you take everything for yourself? The choice is yours.

10/10 I cried to Minecraft

reviewText: Oh yes! I LOVE THIS GAME! To start off,I am a massive Minecraft fan,but,the game has kinda died off in my oinion. The game was alot better with Mojang in charge. However,Minecraft Story Mode actually brings back the old Minecraft. Not too old,there were still beacons,but I mean without the sheep meat and no bunnies with a thirst for killing players all around (COUNT BUNNICULA MUAHAHAHA). But,this game completely changed how I look at Minecraft. Minecraft has gone without an actual story for many years,not knowing the true purpose of the Enderdragon,but the story is now just being made so it's fresh off the bat. Basicly,you are a male or female townsperson named Jesse. You and your friends enter a building competition when an accident happens that stirs the whole story into motion,slowly at first,but it becomes a red hot burning cart ride (Thumbs up if you get the reference) extremely quickly. But the origin of the game shows us that the players in the actual Minecraft game could be members of the Order of the Stone,as the main villian that you have to beat to roll the credits is the Enderdragon. Minecraft Story Mode takes place years after the Enderdragons defeat,instead with a new original boss,The Wither Storm. Not only is this boss terrifying,it can suck you up,eat you,kill you,poision you,use you to become bigger,and shine a purple spotlight on you to float you(wasn't my idea). Every small choice you make could effect the story's ending dramaticly. The game is by TellTaleGames so,what else would you expect? After all,the story is alot more epic and fast paced in some of the fight scenes. Also,one more thing before I give the rating,THE F*CKING SOUNDTRACK! I can listen to it for hours without getting bored! It's something that makes every location in the game feel right,and it builds up the idea that you are doing whatever an adventurer would do these days,except for are someone who feel into the story by accident. The fighting music is amazing too,when you fight zombies and creepers and what else my be creeping out there,the music starts playing and it is good. Not as much so as Final Fantasy XIII,but still good. My rating? 10 out of 10.

reviewText:
With only four of the five episodes released, this game could be finished and I'd be completely content with the ending. When I started with episode one, I knew that i would enjoy the time I spent playing this game. From the well written script and nicely spoken lines by each of the characters, to even the gameplay. The simplistic TellTalle formula has yet again shown that it works and works well. Some may complain that you can't control what happens in the game, but that's the point, it's a story. It's not all about the gameplay, it's about engaging in the narrative that TellTale time and time again has shown what amazing things can come out of a story.

Now let's take a more in-depth analysis of the game. At the beginning, I was a little unsure of how I would feel about the characters, but i did my best to pay attention and take the time to listen to each person that was in my group. I would also select the options that I thought I would be most likely to preform in that situation. By doing that, it made me care about what was going on between the different characters that I interacted with.

Another upside to the game is the combat and quick-time events. Through most of these instances, I was on edge. I wanted to succed in the task at hand because I wanted to continue my epic quest in the world of Minecraft with these friends that I have gained (I know they're basically just pieces of dialogue strung together but I tried to be in perspective of the main character).

The next thing up is the original Minecraft game. For Story Mode, it would be beneficial to you if you have played the original game and possibly have been part of the ever-expanding community to understand fully what you are doing. There are also references to famous events" in the original that I would chuckle at because I fully understood what was going on. BUT even if you didn't play the original

reviewText:
If you're a hardcore Minecrafter: If you like a good storyline, along with a lot of different paths, and the infamous Minecraft universe... don't get this unless a second season is confirmed, or it's on sale: it's kind of a high price for a game like this.

If you're a hardcore Telltale Games fan: see above, however, if you have never heard of Minecraft, and are just getting it because it's from Telltale, you might frustrated with the whole Minecraft setting.

If you're a casual player of both: this is going to be something that you will not regret buying: I mean, COME ON, it can be replayed up to four times!

In conclusion: get this on sale, and have basic knowledge of both Minecraft and games by Telltale Games.

Overall Rating: 8/10. Problems?

*TONS OF CLIPPING

*Severe framerate drops and rises

*The voice acting is something to be asked

reviewText:
If you're a hardcore Minecrafter: If you like a good storyline, along with a lot of different paths, and the infamous Minecraft universe... don't get this unless a second season is confirmed, or it's on sale: it's kind of a high price for a game like this.

If you're a hardcore Telltale Games fan: see above, however, if you have never heard of Minecraft, and are just getting it because it's from Telltale, you might frustrated with the whole Minecraft setting.

If you're a casual player of both: this is going to be something that you will not regret buying: I mean, COME ON, it can be replayed up to four times!

In conclusion: get this on sale, and have basic knowledge of both Minecraft and games by Telltale Games.

Overall Rating: 8/10. Problems?

*TONS OF CLIPPING

*Severe framerate drops and rises

*The voice acting is something to be asked

reviewText:
Minecraft: Story Mode is a story about you, the protagonist, and your group of friends competing to win the EnderCon. It might just seem like a simple building contest, but there's just much more to that. A sinister plot, devised by a former member of the Order of the Stone, was initially designed for vengeance and revenge. However, something goes horribly wrong. Eventually, you find yourself to be of more importance than you think you'd be in a game taking place in a Minecraft world. You, playing as the male or female protagonist Jesse, go on an epic adventure to places people wouldn't dare to go to. Experiencing both hardships and tender moments, you are left to make the tough decisions for your group and ultimately decide how the story will go. Despite the circumstances however, your group still finds a way to crack crude jokes and stay optimistic. Will you put the health of others before your own, or will you take everything for yourself? The choice is yours.

10/10 I cried to Minecraft

still waiting for ep. 5 telltale games pls

reviewText:
This game is pretty good, but it's rushed.

Pros:

+Good story
+Easy choices for younger players and people new to Telltale's games

Cons:

-Bugs happen too often (characters disappearing, character models unintentionally changing to a different character model, etc.)

reviewText: I had high hopes for telletale games based on previous series like the walking dead, Wolf among us and the game of thrones. Surprisingly, despite seeming like a huge cash grab, telletale does manage to deliever in Minecraft: Story Mode as far as the actual Story goes. Although it lacks and meaningful descision making that minecraft actually offers, The wide range of dialogue options does still make you feel involved in the story's progression and in illusion of choice still keeps the game fresh and interesting.\n\nLets be real, if you could actually make major choices in any telletale game they would likely cost alot more than $25 for 5 episodes.

reviewText: Oh yes! I LOVE THIS GAME! To start off,I am a massive Minecraft fan,but,the game has kinda died off in my oinion. The game was alot better with Mojang in charge. However,Minecraft Story Mode actually brings back the old Minecraft. Not too old,there were still beacons,but I mean without the sheep meat and no bunnies with a thirst for killing players all around (COUNT BUNNICULA MUAHAHAHA). But,this game completely changed how I look at Minecraft. Minecraft has gone without an actual story for many years,not knowing the true purpose of the Enderdragon,but the story is now just being made so it's fresh off the bat. Basicly,you are a male or female townsperson named Jesse. You and your friends enter a building competition when an accident happens that stirs the whole story into motion,slowly at first,but it becomes a red hot burning cart ride (Thumbs up if you get the reference) extremely quickly. But the origin of the game shows us that the players in the actual Minecraft game could be members of the Order of the Stone,as the main villian that you have to beat to roll the credits is the Enderdragon. Minecraft Story Mode takes place years after the Enderdragons defeat,instead with a new original boss,The Wither Storm. Not only is this boss terrifying,it can suck you up,eat you,kill you,poision you,use you to become bigger,and shine a purple spotlight on you to float you(wasn't my idea). Every small choice you make could effect the story's ending dramaticly. The game is by TellTaleGames so,what else would you expect? After all,the story is alot more epic and fast paced in some of the fight scenes. Also,one more thing before I give the rating,THE F*CKING SOUNDTRACK! I can listen to it for hours without getting bored! It's something that makes every location in the game feel right,and it builds up the idea that you are doing whatever an adventurer would do these days,except for are someone who feel into the story by accident. The fighting music is amazing too,when you fight zombies and creepers and what else my be creeping out there,the music starts playing and it is good. Not as much so as Final Fantasy XIII,but still good. My rating? 10 out of 10.

reviewText: Legitimately surprised at how disappointing this game was given the hype for the rest of Telltale's games. Gameplay is filled with quicktime events and basic movement and adds nothing to the story. Scenes where you walk around and talk to people are artificially bound by invisible walls that take away the suspension of disbelief, and the repetitive dialogue usually doesn't even add much to the characters. It's as though all of these gameplay" elements (if you could call it that) were added to actively work against your experience of the story.\n\nThat would all be bearable if the story were compelling. You barely get attached to any of the characters

reviewText: In general I guess it's not a bad game but I'm not enough into Minecraft to want to play this myself and the little I have played was very gimiky but I did not really buy it for me.  I think the idea of giving responses in a kind of realtime manner could be a great concept and add depth to an adventure game (Which I do like in general) so on the surface I think Telltale has a neat idea.   However I think they chose the wrong game to use it on.  Minecraft is a game enjoyed by kids as young as 3 years old.  My daughter (5) loves the Fredy Fish games but they don't require any reading.  I though a nice adventure game about one of her favorite subjects that has conversation choices would help encourgae reading.  At 5 she is an advanced reader but not fast enough to try words she has not seen and try and get the meaning of the sentance before the timer ran out.   I'll may try again in another 3-5 years when she has the skills to read fast enough to enjoy the game.  Until then I don't much care for it and it frustrates my daughter so I don't recomend this game.

reviewText: I was very disappointed in Minecraft: Story Mode. I was having trouble finding gameplay footage of it, and I later found out why that was. When I first started the game up, I connected my PS4 controller to it. I tried to play it but found out it was improperly mapped. The game thought Square was X and X was Circle, and it didn't recognize right on the D-Pad. I checked my settings in Big Picture and everything was correct. This is a problem on any game, but an even bigger one because of how this game is structured. I just used the mouse from that point on. The game is very slow, in fact most of it is made up of cutscenes. The only actual gameplay is walking around and clicking on stuff, with occasional conversations with characters where you can choose what you say to them, which is supposed to change the story arc. Also, the only skill" you actually need is to spam click the mouse when fighting mobs

reviewText:
First of all, opinion people, everyone has yours, this is just one more comment, don't type with your fists, type with your brain. Keep hate away and think.
Alright, let's begin.

Even there's much hate about Minecraft and it's Fans, Minecraft is a good game to play, nothing is all about you. If people like, let them, i'm not the OMGF MINECRAFT Fan, but i had my good times with it, today it's not that cool as before becase time passes. I respect the game, some fans indeed are too exaggerated. You need to calm down and think by yourself, and not by the people who play it.

Now by THIS game: Minecraft Story Mode.

First of all if you don't know, the game has 5 Episodes, this is Episode 1, the others are not out yet. A LOT of Telltale games has this (Except like Poker Night and so on). But one thing, you need to PAY for EVERY Episode or buy the Season Pass, which is all the episodes together for a better price. I don't like this, not just for Minecraft Story Mode, but for all games, you pay 1 time, DONE! When the next Episode comes, the game just get updated. Unfortunately it's not like that,
you pay a lot to play just a fragment of the history.

BUT

The Game. The game itself it's NICE, but, why is it like THIS? I have the answer, even it ISN'T Minecraft, it keeps the elements of the game, adapting some things to make the game even better, Crafting is there, Traps is there, Redstone is there and so on. Now, why this? Minecraft it's a SIMPLE game, this is the ELEMENT they keep, SIMPLICITY, keeping the this element from the original game made it unique, not a Minecraft Clone or anything like that.

The graphics.

It's Minecraft, i know, but what i said, elements. It's the original game looking with shaders, worked shadows, sun and so on.

Gameplay.

A Telltale game, what can i say about it, it's point and click with some scene actions and combat, not that hard stuff, but you gotta be watchful to don't miss it. Now something i noticed, i don't know if i didn't missed enought times, but you don't get too punished by missing the actions, like, you just recover yourself instantly, it's not compromising, they should do something about it. The combat is fine, there aren't a lot, yes, but is Episode 1, so yeah.

The History.

This part is where people want to be the best atleast, as a Telltale game, history is one of the BEST elements. As a Telltale game, and a Minecraft based game, the history is good. It's simple, you can understand, it's not complicated, IT'S OBVIOUS THAT YOU HAVE TO PAY ATTENTION TO KEEP PLAYING, >> TELLTALE GAME << You have to know what are you playing. Simplicity = Original element.

Bugs?

Yes, BUT NOT A BIG DEAL, it's with the subtitles, sometimes someone talk something, and then the subtitles is other thing, again, not a big deal. Other thing, scene changes, sometimes they're strange with black screens, not a big deal too. Not more bugs than this, this will not make your experience be DESTROYED. Sometimes bugs can occur, don't be surprise if it occurs, it's a GAME, it's rare but has a chance.

Well, i think it's it!
A score? Well

8.8/10

Do i recommend it? YES. BUT PLEASE FOR THE LOVE OF GOD, read about Telltale games, THIS IS NOT MINECRAFT, it's a SPINN OFF GAME. You're not free to live in this game. You have choices, you choose one and ♥♥♥♥ happens

reviewText: Minecraft the story mode is a great alternative to the Minecraft franchise, The developers have taken it down an alleyway you wouldn't of expected... It isn't as hands on compared to the sandbox game but don't let that put you off it, as it repays you in the fantastic story that will brainwash you into wanting to repeatedly play the first chapter over and over taking different decisions. You the player controls what goes on in the game and the choices you select will determine what happens next. The only down side to the game has actually nothing to do with the in game experience  but how the story is diced up into chapters and one has to wait 5-8 weeks to continue!!! Plus there are 6 chapters to buy so you are looking to complete the game next year due to the marketing process, so don't let the price for the base game manipulate you into thinking it's a great buy! DLC will be mandatory if wanting to complete it. But over all i wouldn't miss it and would recommed you buy it ASAP!

reviewText:
Reviewing each episode individually then the game as a hole
--------------------------------------
SPOILERS AHEAD PLUS THE FACT THAT THIS REVIEW WILL BE INFLUENCED BY THE CHOICES I MADE.
--------------------------------------
SEASON 1
Episode 1. 8/10
----------------
One was definitely my favourite episode. With the introducement to the main characters Jesse, Axel Olivia and Lucas. This sets off as the three friends attempting to build a fireworks stand at a builders tournament and a introduction to the 'Order Of The Stone' in which the victor gets to meet Gabriel the warrior one of the members of the Order. After all of this crap happens you lose your pig and gotta find him meeting Petra the female feminist empowering character. You and her out to sell a wither skull she has found to the main antagonist Ivory or as I call him 'The Shady Guy'. After the interview with Gabriel, Ivory builds a Wither in which the flask inorder to control is stolen from your good buddy Axel and the witherstorm gones ape S**t and starts consuming endercon completey. After a chain of events in which you can save Petra or Galbriel you enter the nether after this you find yourself at the Order's temple you have to finish puzzles in order to use the amulet Galbriel gave you, oh ye he gives you this magical amulet to track the order. You have to choose to go with Olivia to find Ellegard or with Axel to find Magnus. A great fun episode.

Episode 2 6/10
-----------
In this episode you have to choices I went with Olivia so I will tell the story of Ellegard you find her in her city redstonia in which you have to do some redstone crap and get into her thinking block there you must help her build a command block before the witherstorm comes and flips s**t up yet again. After you return you find Galbriel just chillin in the temple with Lucas. Also Axel went to find the other dude. After this you find the tracker to my boy Soren and attempt to track his footsteps at his temple, The two Order members you picked up get hella mad at each other and leave after you run into Ivory in which you find out he was a former Order member, you engage him in battle until he uses some elixir and runs away trapping you and your buddies in a library. This was an ok episode probs oh though I still reckon it was the worst out of the four.

Episode 3 7.5/10
-----------
In this episode you attempt to find Soren yet again losing the amulet while diging out of the temple finding a mob grinder leads you to the End. In there you find a whole wool world Sorens built and a bunch of enderman he is attempting to make them build. After putting the enderman suit on you try to find him, after finding him he punches you and takes you inside his house. There the enderman siege it and you and your buddies must escape. After coming back to surface you make the Super TNT Crap and Magnus and Ellegard are back together fighting the Witherstorm. There you build the bomb and blow the thing up leading to the death of either Ellegard or Magnus. Getting surviors you see that the command block is not damaged and it starts sucking everything up again yet this time there is 3 of them. Finding either Petra or Galbriel you run away into the next episode. This was a good episode exploring some unique themes of the power of being alone for a long period of time.

Episode 4 8/10
-----------
In this episode you run away from the Witherstorm once again and retreat to a crib in the mountains there you find out that Petra has forgotten everything and doesn't remember you. In which you try to figure out stuff about the Witherstorm. Ivory comes along and Soren gets hell mad that the bomb didn't work but Ivory figures out to destroy it using a Enchanted sword in which you and some of your buddies have to use the horses to go the 'Far Lands.' when finally getting there you complete this maze in which it leads you to Ivorys lab there you find out the truth of the Order of the stone and craft the weapon strong enough to destroy the command block in the Witherstorm. After leaving you finally engage the Witherstorm in combat and destroy the command block but not without pay your poor pig Reuben dies. After Galbriel reveals you and your friends are the new 'Order of the stone.' In the end you can tell to reveal the truth about the order or Let the people dream." This episode was sick finally ending the Witherstorm and knowing that nobodies can truly become Legendary.

Overall Minecraft story-mode is really fun game with unique character creation semi-predicatable and for a so called 'kids game' actually pretty dark with touching moments and moments of sorrow and lack of salvation
date:
though the game was pretty quick only took me 7 hours to finish it's still a really funny sick game defiantly  worth buying.
7.5/10 (LETS SAY 1-4 IS SEASON 1 REGARDLESS AS IT ALL LINKS TOGETHER.)
SEASON 2
---- (Will review when all episodes come out.)=="

reviewText:
I'm just going to start off by saying, I don't understand all the hate for this game, sure, the writing isn't as grim or dark as other telltale games, but after just playing episode 4, I really realized how much depth this game has. Your choices make a decievingly large impact on the outcome of your game, at first I didn't realize this, but once I binged past all of the episodes, it all fell together magnificently. Games don't normally bring up strong emotions for me, especially games with famously toxic communities like minecraft, but this game brought up some pretty heavy feels for me more than once. Choose your friends, gender, personality, priorities, strategy, etc. This game is solid, and is a must buy for any telltale fan.

#Phsyched4Episode5

reviewText: As a fan of Minecraft since the Alpha days and lover of Telltale's new format that began with TWD, I was excited about a coming together of two of my favourites in Minecraft: Storymode. I was a little skeptical due to the lack of a story behind Minecraft, but it left Telltale with a blank canvas with which to create a masterpiece. Sadly I feel they've taken the easy option and crafted a dull story, forgettable characters, inconsequential player choices and dialogue that might amount to one weak smile per episode. I expect the game to sell well and may even be their biggest selling game to date due to the IP; and that worries me because I don't want to see Telltale leave behind a formula that I enjoy in favor of bigger profits.\n\nThis is not a game for grown-ups like The Walking Dead, The Wolf Among Us or Game of Thrones. There isn't an adult storyline, nor are there enough subtle nods to grown-ups for it to be enjoyed, ala Disney. I would struggle to even recommend it to anyone with kids, Minecraft lovers or not because it's just not very entertaining.

reviewText:
It's more of an elongated cut-scene with a few game mechanics thrown in. Yes you get to make your own choices, but the timer on the choice menu needs to go away. Let me think about my choices more. Also, give me some warning that I have to hit buttons during action sequences. It just pops up out of nowhere without any warning and I end up missing them about 60% of the time.

Was it enjoyable to watch? Yes. I'm engaged in the storyline, but it was far too short of an episode for the price of $25 USD. I would at most have paid $10 but even that is a bit overpriced.

Would I recommend this 'game'? Yes, but wait until it goes on sale, for it's just not worth it right now. So, no I guess.

reviewText:
The game was amazing. I found every action that I took and every choice I made changed the story in many ways. At the end of Episode 4, I was heartbroken, and I'm not gonna tell you why.

Why I liked the game:

1. Every choice made either shocked me, or it was nothing.

2. In Episode 4, the game starts to reveal secrets about the Order of the Stone.

3. There was many difficult decisions that were made.

Overall, if I had to give a rating for the game, I would give it a 9.75, because the story was rising up until I was crying, one minor flaw is that the audio for the characters sort of fell, short.

reviewText:
This is my 1st comment on a game and what an unbelievable let down this game is.  Yes I love Minecraft so naturally had to by this.  Firstly, there is NO MINING! There isn't much else to do either, other than QTEs.  Oh and to top it off its incredibly short.  This is only the 1st episode of the series and if the others are the same price that will be £70 in total spent on this QTE extravaganza bore (what I would have paid for it approximately).  So not worth it.  The only thing the game does well is the graphics, they match the Minecraft universe perfectly.

Run from the game.......run fast.......and go spend your cash at McDonalds or something.  You'll be more satisfied.

reviewText:
This is a real treat for minecraft fans! The game runs smooth and I have had no gameplay issues. This is a TellTale game at the core and plays how you might expect from that studio.

As of episode 1 we have a nice setup for the rest of them game. Most of the exposition is handled in this episode; the cast is displayed as well as the main conflict. Episode 1 also introduces us to mechanics that will likely show up a lot more later on as well as a few very simple puzzles to ease us into the experience. That said there is not too much excitement in the episode other than how freaking cool it is that Minecraft fans finally get a peice of work with the minecraft theme that is very high quality. Speaking of which, the art direction and writing is fantastic. The only thing that deminishes from the quality is the sometimes (rarely) glitchy animations.

TL;DR
Episode 1 is a high quality fan loving foundation to a game that seems very promising.

reviewText: I enjoyed the first episode.  To be fair, I've never played a telltale game before so I cant compare it to anything, but I thought it was a really interesting story and had a lot of fun with it.  The negitive reviews mostly compare this game to other telltale games, but in my opinion the story was interesting and the animations were pretty decent.  I wish that more decisions mattered, though, I've played through it a couple times and only a few decisions made had any effect on the gameplay.  Overall, I would recomend if you enjoy Minecraft and aren't going to be put off if this game is different from other Telltale games.  Also, i would like to note that I played this game on mobie, because it doesnt work on intel based macs.

reviewText:
This game looks good, and even though it seems to be geared towards a younger audience I still thought the story/characters/etc were reasonably entertaining.  But my issue is this felt less like a game and more like an interactive movie.

It felt like I was watching Minecraft videos through YouTube.  You watch a video, and then it prompts you to go to the next video and you just have to hit play.  There is a little variety with QTE (yaaaaayyyyy...), fighting, QTE, dialog, QTE, etc.

Note that this is just based on about the first hour of gameplay.  Maybe there are actual puzzles or challenges of some sort later on, or the story gets really interesting.  But at full price I'm not seeing the value.  I just want to get it returned.  I honestly don't even feel great about losing the hour I spent playing it.

But I'm sure if you have younger kids they'd have a blast with this though!
voteText: 6 of 14 people (43%) found this review helpful

reviewText: If you want a Telltale game, play something else. The stoy is full of bad tropes, the voice acting is near robotic, and the is little to be said about the characters themselves. It's hard to tell what age group this is targeted at due to a grab bag of childish jokes and the occasional cussing. Seriously, go play The Wolf Among Us or Tales from the Borderlands instead. Thy are spectacular games that has plot development and makes you care about the characters. I actually skipped the optional chat time with characters in M:SM so I could get to the next part.

reviewText:
I can understand why some people are unhappy with this game. The game feels a bit rushed. The decisions you make don't seem very important, and maintaining a good relationship with the other characters is incredibly easy. I've been a complete ♥♥♥♥♥♥ to Axel, and the big dope still loves me.

This game is very atmospheric, The buildings look amazing inside and out, and are completely buildable in a normal minecraft world. If you played Minecraft as much as I used to, this game will bring back very good memories and will easily put a smile on your face. Also, Rueben (Jesse's pet pig)  is such a loveable character.

8/10  I think that if you're a big enough fan of Minecraft, you'll be able to look past it's flaws and just like it for what it is.

reviewText:
The 1st part episode of the story was done alright. Decent dialogue and plot to take part for the rest of the adventure. Ep 2 seemed pretty pointless to me and could of been added into episode 1.

*Spoiler* (possibly)

Whoever you choose to go after, ellegard or magnus. You end up finding both of them anyway, so your choice doesn't even matter. And the path you take in ep 2 isn't really much choice, just a tiny bit of info for a whole episode. During the second episode, you find 1 (end up both) of the legendary heroes. Which the story is pretty rushed due to finding the hero, getting their help, and that's it.

So far, the game has been pretty good running at smooth 60fps with minor glitches. Decent story and enjoyment for a more casual play.

reviewText:
This game is surprisingly good but with a catch
First I'll go over the Pro's then I'll go through the cons.

Pros
--------------------
*Amazing Story
*Awesome Characters
*Nice additions to the Minecraft world
*Epic Music
*Quality Voice Acting
*Humorous Writting
*Drama

Cons
------------
*Bugs and Glitches everywhere
*Poor lip synching
*Glitchy lighting
*Bad Grammar
*Lots of Mispelled words in settings, menus, and in game
*Cut off speech


The thing is that this is a great game affected by huge bugs! A scene that is supposed to be dramatic can be ruined by cut off speach and bad lip syncing. This has happened to me at least 2 or 3 times in the 3 Episodes I've played.
But this game is worth buying and playing despite the bugs.

reviewText:
Minecraft: Story Mode. This is a spoiler-free review.

First and formost, lets speak about if it's necessary to play Minecraft to play this game. The short answer is no, you do not require any experience whatsoever with Minecraft to play this game. In the few crafting parts, there is an option to the bottom right that shows you the recipe you must use to aquire the item you're attempting to obtain. Although it does feel as if we are playing in the Minecraft universe, this is something I thought was very important to point out.

THE STORY

The Story follows a character named Jesse. At the beginning of the game, it offers you six options, in which you get to pick from three skins for each gender. Although I cannot say much about the story itself without spoiling how the plot unravels, the game follows Jesse (you) and a couple of side characters, each joining you according to your decisions. The game centers around these decisions. What made the story fascinating to me was mostly the characters, for they were the ones who made this game truly enjoyable. Often I'd find myself thinking I was watching a movie, and laughing or chuckling at these characters as they have a funny script, and amazing personalities.

For the characters, and how the story is unraveled to us slowly, I'll give this a fine 9/10. The story could've been better, but the characters are the ones who truly made rise to this.

THE GAMEPLAY

Minecraft: Story Mode's gameplay is very similar to The Walking Dead season 1 and season 2 from Telltale games aswell. You have very simple controls, the typical W, A, S, D. to move, L-SHIFT to sprint, Q, and E on some occasions and in the fighting scenes you must use the Left Mouse click and Right Mouse click.

The most important factor of this whole gameplay is the decision making. If you are here for fighting scenes or even COD graphics, this is most certainly not the game for you. The game is what I could easily say 93% of the game is you in a cutscene, making choices as other characters speak to you. What I found very handy is that while making these choices, you are allowed to press Space Bar, to pause the game and think in case you are a slow reader.

There are some rare occasions in which you will be forced to fight mobs. In which you use W and S to move forward and back. Left-Mouse click to swing/shoot and Right-Mouse click to switch weapons. The A and D only play part in changing targets. This at first seemed pretty hard for me, but I got the hang of it quickly.

Each episode from the game is pretty long, but the game itself will save automatically in between cutscenes or when you're changed to free movement. There is an in the main menu in which you can search for, which is the rewind".. This will allow you to jump back in time to one of the 6 most important points of the chapter in case you feel you did something wrong. Feel free to leave the game whenever you want
date: for the save system happens rather frequently.\n\nThe gameplay deserves a 10/10
recommended:
for this is an easy system to learn and really enjoyable too for the right public.

GRAPHICS/MUSIC

At first I was gonna say the graphics on this game are not impressive
hoursPlayed: as it is already expected the game will give you blocky characters
voteText: blocky landscapes. I soon changed my mind once I saw how proper the animations were on every character
helpfulPercent: and the moment I had forgotten I was playing Minecraft: Story Mode but instead felt like I was playing the original Minecraft because the mobs look identical. I thought this was something I should highlight
votesHelpful: considering it has great animation on their faces
votesTotal: since they make expressions and movements. I wouldn't have expected any more
votesFunny: but I sure expected a lot less. I found myself wondering if I could build these places
commentsCount: and also looking at the game as if it were a movie
column16:
because its animations surpassed all my expectations.

Graphics deserve a 10/10 for surpassing my expectations.

Music on this game is rather repetitive. During cutscenes I'd find myself humming to the song because it was the same one. Although I never minded the music
column17: I found that some people would find this annoying. It does not use any music by Mojang as far as I'm concerned.\n\nI never was a fan of music
column18:
but I liked this particular theme so I'll give it an 8/10.

OVERALL

This is the TL;DR section. Although I'd reccomend you read the entire thing

reviewText:
EPISODE 1 - The Order of the Stone

That game impressed me a lot, i didn't watch too much of gameplays that were made for this game because i didn't wanted too much spoilers, but what i saw in gameplays aren't even the half compared to what i played. Dude, this was amazing, some choices were really tough, i've never experienced that thougness when i was playing Jurassic Park: The Game. Now i can't wait for the next episode, i'll update this review when i get to play the next episode. Telltale, good job with this game, you guys have done this game really well! Keep up with the good work! :)


EPISODE 2 - Assembly Required

So, i was really excited to see what was going to happen on Ep. 2, so i was seeing the Telltale's forums so i could see news about that game. And for everyone's surprise: What was going to be released in 24th November suddenly got released in 27 (28 for me) October, just  two weeks after the first episode. About the episode: It started really exciting, i saw things that Telltale has decided to improve, for example, we could ask 3 questions for some people, something that was added to JP:TG and BTTF:TG. I saw result of choices i've made on the first episode, i thought that trying to save Petra or Gabriel would give us the same result: Petra escaped,Gabriel didn't, because Ivor said that saw the girl" running the opposite direction. But i did some search and realized that this was just something that Telltale didn't care too much. Unfornately
